data.title: Current Residents
data.meta_description: Official website for the University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine
data.text:
Lauren Celentano, M.D.

Medical School: University of Buckingham

Undergraduate School: University of St Andrews

Clinical Interests: Forensics and ED psychiatry

Research Interests: Psychopharmacology

Other Interests/Hobbies: In my free time I enjoy scuba diving, fishing, and long distance running.

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Growing up in South Florida, coming back home to Miami was an easy choice. I love being outside, in the ocean, and exploring Miami. Training at Jackson/UM psychiatry lets you see a variety of different patients from different backgrounds as well as the opportunity to work with clinical staff from three different hospitals. It’s an amazing program with countless opportunities and an equally great place to live and work.

Kelly Conley, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

David Gomez, M.D.

Medical School: Florida International University

Undergraduate School: Florida International University

Clinical Interests: Consult Liaison, Addiction, and Community Psychiatry

Other Interests/Hobbies:

Meditation and mindfulness training

Freediving, spearfishing, line fishing, and boating

Traveling, visiting national and state parks

Soccer, basketball, football, and fantasy football

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? I chose Jackson/UM because of the residency program's diversity in training sites, multi-cultural patient population, high case volume, large and diverse residency class, commitment to the underserved, and abundant fellowship opportunities.

Jake Goodman, M.D., MBA

Medical School: Thomas Jefferson University

Undergraduate School: University of Georgia, Go Dawgs.

Clinical Interests: Addiction, Mood Disorders

Research Interests: None at the moment

Other Interests/Hobbies: Advocating for mental health on social media, playing soccer and tennis, eating food, gardening

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? Spending 4 winters in the North crushed my soul. I chose Miami due to warm weather + beach + vibrant city + amazing residents.

Alexandra Held, M.D.

Medical School: FIU Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Florida

Clinical Interests: Child & Adolescent, Forensic Psychiatry

Research Interests: Open to many areas. Most interested in Psychotic Disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: Traveling to the mountains, photography, caring for my many bonsai trees, spending time with family

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

I rotated here as a fourth-year medical student and was quickly impressed by the collegiality amongst the residents. Additionally, I wanted the opportunity to treat underserved patients at one of the largest safety net hospitals in the country. Not to mention the food, culture, and beautiful skyline of Miami is hard to beat!

Marie Holly, M.D.

Medical School: St. George’s University

Undergraduate School: McGill University

Clinical Interest: Child & Adolescent Psychiatry, Perinatal Psychiatry

Research Interest: Dissociative Disorders, ADHD

Other Interest/Hobbies: Traveling and exploring new cultures, finding newrestaurants, running/jogging, reading, watching movies

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

This program fosters strong academics alongside resident wellness, which is rare to find! I also chose to train here because of the diverse patient population and all the wonderful residents/faculty I met during my residency interview!

Bacheline Joseph, D.O.

Medical School: Nova Southeastern School of Osteopathic Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Florida

Clinical Interest: Psychotherapy, Emergency Psychiatry

Research Interest: Cultural psychiatry, Nutritional psychiatry

Other interest/hobbies: Mindfulness, Fitness, Cooking, Music, Art

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Coming from a small town in Haiti, I was raised in a community where mental illness was a stigma. As a result, I developed a strong interest in cross-cultural psychiatry. Residency at Jackson / U.M. psychiatry allows me to explore my interest in mental health through a diverse and robust training experience. Additional factors that influenced my decision included research opportunities, mentorship, and various clinical settings.

Scott Leary, M.D.

Medical School: Florida International University College of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Alabama

Clinical Interests: Consultation-Liaison Psychiatry, LGBTQI+ Mental Health, Medical Education, Trauma, Global Health

Research Interests: behavioral and pharmacologic interventions for patients with major depression, anxiety, and tic disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: Spending time with my dog, playing and watching tennis, learning to cook, trying new restaurants

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

The diversity of patients, providers, clinical settings, and psychopathologies seen as a trainee

Sean Oldak, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Miami

Clinical Interests: psychopharmacology, Child and Adolescent Psychiatry, Forensic Psychiatry

Research Interests: psychopharmacology, psychotic disorders, and mood disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: reading, Survivor, TV, movies

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

The incredibly supportive environment and the ability to be able to work with such a diverse and amazing population across three incredible and unique medical institutions

Manasi Parrish, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Southern California

Clinical Interests: Emergency Psychiatry, Perinatal Mental Health, Forensic Psychiatry

Research Interests: PTSD & Veterans Mental Health, Perinatal Depression & Anxiety

Other Interests/Hobbies: cooking, swimming, riding my Peloton bike, weight lifting, walking my golden retriever, going to the beach, visiting family on the West Coast, and most importantly spending time with my husband & baby

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

I was lucky enough to become a double hurricane when I couples matched at Jackson/UM after my husband and I spent the last 4 years at UM for medical school. There are so many reasons I chose to stay at Jackson—the diverse patient population, the stand-alone psychiatry hospital and crisis center, the team-based learning environment, and the ability to meaningfully engage in treating veterans at the Miami VAMC. The beautiful weather, the warm ocean water, & the palm trees helped sway our decision, too!

Alvaro Teixeira Filho, M.D.

Medical School: Universidade Federal de Goiás

Clinical interests: Acutely ill psychiatric patients

Research interests: Psychotic Disorders

Other interests/hobbies: I learned how to drive an electric unicycle this year. I also enjoy solving jigsaw puzzles, playing board games, and chilling at the beach with my dog while reading Stephen King books (The Dark Tower, anyone?).

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

The distinctiveness of multi-site rotation at one campus and an academic department serving a community that is tremendously diverse - it’s an impressive clinical experience. Also, the sense of family that every resident is proud of!

Vishnu Tiwari, M.D.

Medical School: SUNY Downstate Medical Center College of Medicine

Mario Renato Velit, M.D.

Medical School: Universidad Peruana Cayetano Heredia

Clinical Interests: Consultation-Liaison

Research Interests: Machine learning in Psychiatry

Other Interests/Hobbies: Meditation, Yoga, Video games, Computer programming

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Miami attracts a large number of the Latin American population, which allows me to continue to practice medicine in English and in Spanish as I've always intended to. The resources available for research are incredible with the University of Miami, and the research track is also available for PGY1s. The training is rigorous, the cases at Jackson can be complex but incredibly rewarding, and the atmosphere is welcoming. The city has great weather, looks beautiful (especially at night with all the lights) and I am so thrilled to be part of this amazing experience!

Alan Alvarez de Sotomayor, M.D.

Medical School: Indiana University School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Florida (Go Gators!)

Clinical Interests: CL Psychiatry, CAAP, and Inpatient Psychiatry

Research Interests: Barriers to pursuing and maintaining mental health care for Spanish speakers

Other Interests/Hobbies: traveling, dancing, photography, trying new foods/cuisines, art

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

This program stood out and possessed all the qualities that are important to me in a training program: a large teaching hospital in an urban rich city; a diverse community of people, patients, and colleagues who have unique perspectives; and most importantly, the chance to serve patients who primarily speak Spanish. After I interviewed the camaraderie amongst the residents was the best I had seen amongst any interview. Jackson/UM Psychiatry feels like a family and like a second home back home in Miami!

Alexandra Cabrera, M.D.

Medical School: Florida International University Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine

Undergraduate School: Florida State University (Go Noles!)

Anthony DeLuca, M.D.

Medical School: Sidney Kimmel Medical College at Thomas Jeﬀerson University

Undergraduate School: University of Pittsburgh

Clinical Interests: Virtual Reality (VR) integration with outpatient therapy

Research Interests: Assessing risks associated with VR use in children and adolescents

Other Interests/Hobbies: video gaming, playing musical instruments, streaming on twitch, dancing

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

It was deﬁnitely my “gut feeling” program. The comradery among residents was particularly apparent, the education top tier, and honestly you can’t beat Miami Beach! This program is amazing and I feel super blessed to work with so many amazing co-residents, attendings, nurses, and staﬀ.

Nadia Fleurantin, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Florida

Clinical Interests: Child & Adolescent Psychiatry

Research Interests: Health disparities

Other Interests/Hobbies: Dance, anything related to music, comedy shows, spending time with family

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Uniquely diverse patient population, exceptional training experience, ability to make an impactful diﬀerence, close-knit residents, opportunities for professional growth.

D. Andrea Gurfinchel Zevallos, M.D.

Medical School: Universidad Peruana Cayetano Heredia Facultad de Medicina Alberto Hurtado - Peru

Undergraduate School: Newton College

Clinical Interests: Inpatient psychiatry, Forensics, academic psychiatry

Research Interests: Schizophrenia, mood disorders, personality disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: martial arts, weightlifting, traveling, playing musical instruments, reading romance novels.

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

The program offers excellent clinical training and the opportunity to work at one of the busiest (and most exciting!) psych EDs in the US. Its strong commitment to diversity is one of the aspects that most stood out by far and serving minority groups, such as the Hispanic population, is always very gratifying. The comradery between residents is unparalleled and this makes work very enjoyable. Additionally, Miami is a beautiful place to live in, I love the weather and culture here, and I don’t feel far from home at all.

Ana Eugenia Iglesias, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Miami

Clinical Interests: Child and adolescent psychiatry, women’s mental health

Research Interests : Undecided

Other Interests/Hobbies: Working out, reading, traveling, reality TV shows

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

This program has it all - diverse patient population, supportive co-residents and faculty, and an abundance of clinical and research opportunities. We also receive meal stipends, STEP 3 reimbursement, and free health insurance! Outside of work, Miami has so much to offer (beaches, incredible food scene, and endless arts/cultural events), it’s easy to find something you’ll enjoy!

Lara Juan Martinuzzi, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Miami

Clinical Interest: Geriatric psychiatry, child and adolescent psychiatry

Research Interest: Schizophrenia, preventative medicine

Other Interest/Hobbies: cooking, dinner parties with friends, anything outdoors, traveling, and trying to read a couple of books every year!

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

I knew I was going into psychiatry since before medical school and UM/Jackson was my dream program. During medical school I got to know the faculty, residents, and staff. I felt at home. I’m grateful to be able to serve minority populations in Miami while training alongside experienced faculty and staff.

Josefina Kather, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Vermont

Clinical Interests: Child and adolescent psychiatry, psychotherapy, nutritional psychiatry, migrant mental health

Research Interests: Preventative medicine, suicide and self-injurious behaviors in youth, brain-gut connection, mental health care disparities in the Hispanic community

Other Interests/Hobbies: Travel, exercise, spending time with family, friends and my cat, exploring south Florida

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

As a medical student, I had the opportunity to appreciate the diverse patient population and psychopathology encountered at this program, as well as work with exceptional attendings. I knew it would be an excellent place to train.

Anton Lima, M.D.

Medical School: Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE) Faculdade de Medicina - Brazil

Undergraduate School: N/A

Clinical Interests: Mood disorders, outpatient psychiatry

Research Interests: immune-dysfunction in mood disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: sports, movies, mental health promotion in social media, exploring new places in South Florida

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Complete program with 5 ACGME-accredited fellowships, one of the busiest psych EDs in the country, experient faculty, exceptional level of camaraderie between residents, sunny weather to keep me connected with my Brazilian roots. My dream program!

Mika Mintz, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: Colby College, Waterville, ME

Clinical Interests: Psychotherapy, Psychodynamic Psychiatry, Psychoanalysis

Research Interests: Nature as medicine, Psychedelic-assisted therapy

Other Interests/Hobbies: Hiking/camping, photography, dance, travel

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Sara Mourani, M.D.

Medical School: American University of Beirut Faculty of Medicine

Daniel Organista, M.D.

Medical School: Universidad de Los Andes-Facultad de Medicina - Colombia

Clinical interests: Crisis. Maybe Geriatrics

Research interests: Psychoneuroimmunology!

Other interests/hobbies: I like to lift weights, freedive, create social media

content, and learn new things.

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

It’s my dream program. The attendings are compassionate, highly skilled, and knowledgeable. The program is as close as a family. We get exposure to ALL types of patients and psychopathologies. It’s close to downtown Miami, Brickell, South Beach... I love it.

Jacob Rosewater, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Miami

Clinical Interests: Child/Adolescent Psychiatry, Addiction Psychiatry, Outpaitent

Research Interests: Anxiety and mood disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: Playing music, outdoor adventures, cooking, reading, drawing/painting

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Having gone to medical school here, I knew I would not be disappointed by the diversity found in both the patient population and within the residency program! Our training is well-rounded and high-volume; between the safety net that is Jackson, the veterans at the Miami VA, and UM’s private hospital, we truly see everything. My amazing co-residents, knowledgeable and friendly attendings, and the warm weather year-round bring it all together quite nicely; come to Miami!

Lauren Taylor, M.D.

Medical School: University of Virginia School of Medicine

Adela Buciuc, M.D.

Medical School: Universitatea de Medicina si Farmacie Carol Davila Facultatea de Medicina - Romania

Undergraduate School: -

Clinical Interests: Addiction Psychiatry, Perinatal mental health, Schizophrenia

Research Interests: Schizophrenia prodrome, Cognitive decline in schizophrenia spectrum disorders

Other Interests/Hobbies: Sailing with my dad, terrarium making, stand-up paddle boarding

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? I chose to train here for so many reasons - the amazing people that I met during the interview, the commitment to diversity, the approach to integrated care and the location! I felt that UM is a place where I would be supported in my journey in psychiatry and be able to thrive in and outside of the hospital.

Claudia Cabrera-Suarez, M.D.

Medical School: Universidad Peruana Cayetano Heredia Facultad de Medicina Alberto Hurtado Peru

Undergraduate School: -

Clinical Interests: Women mental health, consultation-liason psychiatry, personality disorders, psychotherapy.

Research Interests: Perinatal depression/psychosis, personality disorders and suicide.

Other Interests/Hobbies: protecting the environment, spending time with my family specially outdoors, enjoying nature, reading mystery novels and coffee.

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry?

Since I knew I wanted to do psychiatry in the US, UM/ Jackson was my dream program because it is well known for being very academic, with excellent attendings emphasizing resident training. Here, as residents, we will be exposed to various patient populations with different cultures and backgrounds, enriching us as professionals and human beings.

Alexandra Coppa, M.D., MA

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Graduate School: Salve Regina University

Undergraduate School: Brown University

Clinical Interests: Child & Adolescent Psychiatry, Childhood Trauma, Eating Disorders, Body Image, Mood Disorders, Integrative Medicine

Research Interests: Adverse Childhood Experiences, disordered eating, function of behaviors, therapeutic effects of yoga and movement

Other Interests/Hobbies: dancer, Buti Yoga instructor, former Miss Rhode Island

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? I am interested in how eating disorders present in different cultures where body standards vary and want to address possible issues with the diagnostic criteria that exclude these individuals, preventing recognition and treatment. Miami is a city diverse in both culture and body standards, and of course, I love the warm weather and sunny skies!

Heidi Kiziah, M.D.

Medical School: Nova Southeastern University Dr. Kiran C. Patel College of Allopathic Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Central Florida

Clinical Interests: Personality disorders, treatment resistant depression, psychosis, LGBTQ+ mental health

Research Interest: HIV mental health, LGBTQ+ mental health, treatment resistant depression, medical education

Other Interests/Hobbies: Rock climbing, hiking, paddle-boarding, reading on the beach

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry: As a born-and-raised South Floridian, Jackson/UM was the perfect place to receive high-quality training while serving the community that helped raise me. Jackson/UM is full of opportunities to work with a diverse population with a wide variety of pathologies.

Anish Laul, M.D.

Medical School: Maulana Azad Medical College, Delhi University - India

Undergraduate School: -

Clinical Interests: Forensic psychiatry, Neuropsychiatry, Neuromodulation and Interventional Psychiatry, Integrative Medicine

Research Interests: Psychotic disorders, Psychedelics, Neuromodulation, Psychopharmacology

Other Interests/Hobbies: Travelling, Reading philosophy, Meditation, Poetry, Playing chess

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? The clinically diverse experience that Jackson/UM provides, along with the robust academic curriculum, research framework, and conducive environment that it fosters, aligns perfectly with my career aspirations. Miami's diverse culture, warm weather, and recreational opportunities appealed to me.

Amy Legros, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine Undergraduate School: University of Florida

Clinical Interests: Consult-Liaison Psychiatry, Forensic Psychiatry, Community Psychiatry, Cultural psychiatry

Research Interests: psychosis and schizophrenia

Other Interests/Hobbies: Haitian/African folk dance, yoga, meditation

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? I love learning about the intersection of culture and mental health, particularly concerning people from the Caribbean and Latin America. Therefore, Miami was a perfect place for me to practice.

Jessica D. Leuchter, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Miller School of Medicine

Graduate School: University of Michigan Rackham Graduate School

Undergraduate School: Wake Forest University

Clinical Interest: Child and Adolescent Psychiatry

Research Interest: Obsessive-Compulsive and Related Disorders

Other Interest/Hobbies: Hanging out with my family

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? My undergraduate psychiatry medical education was excellent because of the diverse patient population and high volume of patients and I wanted to continue that training. Miami is also unique in that it’s a great balance between an academic research institution with a strong community focus.

Fayeza Malik, M.D.

Medical School: Florida International University Herbert Wertheim College of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Miami

Clinical Interest: psychotherapy, child and adolescent

Research Interest: child and adolescent

Other interest/hobbies: basketball, movies, hiking, spending time with family

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? exposure to a diverse patient population and opportunity to work longitudinally with the population in my community to address their unique mental health needs.

Aisa Moreno-Megui, M.D.

Medical School: Keck School of Medicine of the University of Southern California

Undergraduate School: Johns Hopkins University

Clinical Interests: Child and Adolescent Psychiatry; Psychotherapy; Community/Cultural Psychiatry

Research Interests: Treatment-Resistant depression; Delirium

Other Interests/Hobbies: Long-distance running; Camping/Backpacking; Board games

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? Jackson/UM offered everything I wanted: a multicultural patient population, a community-focused academic center with diverse hospital settings, and kind and sincere interactions with faculty and residents on interview day. Additionally, Miami is a sunny and vibrant city, near my significant other’s family, that I am looking forward to exploring and getting to know even better.

Daniel Noe, M.D., MBA

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Graduate School: University of Miami Herbert Business School

Undergraduate School: University of Florida

Clinical Interests: Consult & Liaison Psychiatry, Community Psychiatry, Psychotherapy, Mood Disorders, LGBTQ+ Mental Health

Research Interests: Treatment Resistant Depression, Psychosis, Financial Barriers to Care, Neuromodulation, Addiction

Other Interests/Hobbies: Hiking, Long-Distance Running, Bonsai Trees, Travel

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? After spending the last five years here in Miami, I love the combination of a strong academic center with community outreach and medical education. The diverse patient population and impressive case load provide trainees unparalleled exposure to all aspects of Psychiatric Medicine and Mental Health Support.

Jamie Odzer, M.D.

Medical School: The Warren Alpert Medical School of Brown University

Undergraduate School: Brown University

Clinical Interests: Child and Adolescent Psychiatry, Psychotherapy, Community Psychiatry, Young Adult Psychiatry, Personality Disorders, Developmental Disorders

Research Interests: Personality Disorders, Autism Spectrum Disorder, ADHD

Other Interests/Hobbies: Hiking, Playing Tennis, TV and Film, Star Wars, The Miami Heat, playing with other people’s dogs

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? Having grown up in South Florida, Miami has always been home to me, and I’m excited to give back to the people and community that raised me. Additionally, Miami as a city is so wonderfully diverse in its people, perspectives, and opportunities and Jackson/UM reflects that in its residency programs and patient population, which is an ideal environment to train in.

Meghan Salgia, M.D.

Medical School: University of Miami Leonard M. Miller School of Medicine

Undergraduate School: University of Chicago

Clinical interests: Consult Liason Psychiatry, Addiction, Reproductive Psychiatry, Psychotherapy

Research interests: Treatment Resistant Depression, Addiction, Psychedelics

Other interests/hobbies: Playing badminton and tennis, traveling, hiking, running, paddle boarding

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? Throughout my medical school training in Miami I have seen that the city is home to an extremely diverse set of patients and pathologies. I am excited to continue working with these populations and look forward to the ample opportunities for community outreach offered here. Another reason I chose to stay at Jackson/UM is the wonderful training environment and faculty/residents that love to teach. I look forward to making Miami my home for another four years!

Cylena Stewart, M.D.

Medical School: Florida State University College of Medicine

Undergraduate School: Franklin and Marshall University

Clinical interests: Child & Adolescent Psychiatry, Pediatric Addiction Psychiatry, Community Psychiatry

Research interests: First Break Psychosis, Trauma informed care

Other interests/hobbies: Cooking, trying new local restaurants, traveling, reading, and spending time with my kiddos.

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? As someone who was born and raised in Miami, UM/Jackson gives me the opportunity to give back to my community, while practicing psychiatry with a culturally diverse patient population. UM/Jackson also has a strong academic focus, with amazing faculty, that opens the doors for research opportunities that will allow me to better serve my patients for years to come. Miami is home and I am beyond happy to be back.

Adam Takatsuka, M.D.

Medical School: Rush Medical College of Rush University Medical Center

Undergraduate School: UCLA

Clinical Interests: Inpatient psychiatry, psychosis, forensics

Research Interests: Therapeutic uses of psychedelics

Other Interests/Hobbies: Climbing, backpacking, piano and drums, gaming

Why did you choose to train at Jackson/UM Psychiatry? UM/Jackson offers incredible clinical opportunities with great diversity of both patients and psychopathology. Miami itself is an exciting city full of culture. I also love sunshine, warmth, palm trees, and beaches.
